results.title: Operations Associate
results.description:
At Convergent Research we launch large-scale, high-impact science projects. We aim to help fill a structural gap in today's R&D system. We enable fundamental research that requires unusual levels of scale and coordination yet is not rapidly monetizable by industry. We’re bringing together top talent from academia, industry, and startups to build a new model for innovative R&D. As an incubator within the Schmidt Futures Network, we identify high-impact scientific or technical research and development opportunities, ultimately defining and launching these projects as Focused Research Organizations.
 
The operations associate will support the administration and daily operational activities for the Convergent Research team. We are looking for a reliable, organized, and enthusiastic admin who can work in a fast paced environment to help the team run smoothly and efficiently. 



You are:
  • Team player. You are an active listener and great communicator who is flexible and happy to help your teammates at any opportunity!
  • Highly organized and good with data. You can prioritize tasks and create Excel spreadsheets and documents with all of the information you’ve collected in a timely manner. 
  • Detail oriented. You notice the little things. When something is missing, out of place, or wrong, you make sure it gets addressed before it becomes a problem.
  • Solution oriented. When you identify an issue - a process isn’t working or something is amiss, you come prepared with possible solutions to fix it.
  • Eager to learn. You are open-minded, curious, and enjoy learning new things and new tools! You are the first to volunteer to take on new challenges!
  • Tech-savvy. A new project management system is implemented throughout the organization? No problem, you are an early adopter of anything tech. You are a pro (or can easily become a pro) with tools such as Notion, Slack, and Lever.
  • A great juggler. Startups move at a fast-pace and you are able to change priorities and handle multiple tasks at once without blinking. Actual juggling is always a plus.



You will:
  • Support vendor onboarding, collect forms, and documents, make phone calls, send out emails and follow up with internal and external stakeholders. 
  • Review invoices to ensure accuracy and categorize them in the correct class and accounts.
  • Assist with recruiting, updating job descriptions, posting on job boards, and scheduling interviews.
  • Prepare and submit expense reports and associated documentation on time each month.
  • Manage calendars and light travel.
  • Be a keen observer of our internal processes, enthusiastically seek new ways to contribute operationally and suggest improvements to our existing processes.



In three months, you will:
  • Take primary responsibility for onboarding new vendors on a weekly basis. You’ll collect W-9 forms, New Vendor Forms, and Bank Verification Letters to submit to billing. Complete and return credit check information and get ACH bank information as necessary. 
  • Learn how to review invoices to categorize them into classes and accounts.
  • Become the primary point of contact of scheduling interviews and managing our applicant tracking system.
  • Become one of the individuals your colleagues come to with questions on our operational processes because you have demonstrated your adaptability and quick collection of know-how.



We offer:
  • An opportunity to change the world and work with some of the smartest and the most talented experts from different fields.
  • Excellent medical, dental, and vision insurance through a PPO plan; parental leave.
  • Generous time off + paid holidays.
  • Wellness allowance for fitness and wellness activities.
  • Support for fully remote work.
  • Frequent opportunities to spend time with colleagues in person.
 
 
Convergent Research aims to help fill a structural gap in today's R&D system. We enable fundamental research that requires unusual levels of scale and coordination yet is not rapidly monetizable by industry. We’re bringing together top talent from academia, industry, and startups to build a new model for innovative R&D. As an incubator within the Schmidt Futures Network, we identify high-impact scientific or technical research and development opportunities, ultimately defining and launching these projects as Focused Research Organizations.
 
Convergent Research, LLC is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer that proudly pursues and hires a diverse workforce. We do not make hiring or employment decisions on the basis of race, color, religion or religious belief, ethnic or national origin, nationality, sex, gender, gender-identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, military or veteran status, or any other basis protected by applicable local, state, or federal laws or prohibited by Company policy. We strive for a healthy and safe workplace and strictly prohibit harassment of any kind.

results.title: Operations Lead
results.description:
About Swing Left

Swing Left is a national grassroots organization working to elect Democrats up and down the ballot. We make it possible for anyone to make an impact on the elections that determine the balance of power in our country, by volunteering in and donating to key races. Since launching in 2017, Swing Left volunteers have raised $80 million for Democratic candidates, civic organizations, and voter mobilization efforts, and made more than 44 million combined phone calls, door knocks, and letters sent to voters via our affiliate Vote Forward and their partners.

About Vote Forward

Vote Forward is a 501(c)(4) nonprofit organization that builds tools to encourage Americans to vote. We work to increase the participation of traditionally underrepresented groups in the electorate, and to increase civic engagement among the public at large, by supporting the volunteers working to engage these voters. Since 2018, more than 250,000 grassroots volunteers have used the Vote Forward platform to send handwritten letters to more than 25 million prospective voters to encourage them to register to vote and turn out for elections. Vote Forward is closely affiliated with Swing Left, and Vote Forward staff work with Swing Left on many projects of mutual interest.

Overview

The objective of the Operations Lead is to ensure ongoing operational functionality and effective budget management, and a workplace that is equitable, sustainable, effective, and engaged, by leading financial, compliance, legal, administrative, and people programs for Swing Left and Vote Forward. This role reports to the Managing Director and is an at-will position.

We aim to begin interviews for this position by early February. We expect to review the first batch of applications by January 20 and then will do a rolling review of applications until the position is filled and/or the application is closed. Please note that our office is closed between December 17 – January 2.

Responsibilities 

Lead the development and implementation of financial, accounting, compliance, legal, and operational procedures and programs to ensure the organizations' ongoing financial health and compliance 

  • Lead the development and implementation of simple and accurate financial, accounting and budget policies and processes to ensure effective, efficient, and well-informed resource allocation and budget decisions by the Executive Director, and to ensure adherence to financial programs for tracking and reporting purposes 
  • Lead the development and implementation of financial compliance and legal procedures for the organization and ensure efficient communication of and cross-functional adherence to these procedures; identify and implement improvements and updates to current processes to increase effectiveness and efficiency 
  • Lead the processes to procure, assess, audit and implement the virtual office tools and employee resources needed to run the organization effectively and team members are set up for success to do the work required of their position and meet the needs of the organization 
  • Lead the execution of financial health reporting to the executive team

Oversee the development, implementation, and execution of people programs and initiatives to ensure an effective, engaged, diverse, equitable, and inclusive workforce 

  • Oversee the development, implementation, and execution of people programs, including position development, hiring, onboarding, employee retention, internships, and offboarding, to ensure these programs are effective and equitable, meet legal requirements, and follow HR best practices
  • Review and approve position descriptions, compensation, and other employment requirements to ensure programs and processes are applied consistently and equitably across employees 
  • Lead the development and execution of feedback and employee development initiatives, including management training for supervisors, performance evaluations, and employee engagement surveys

Serve as a member of the organization's leadership team: collaborate with other leadership team members and executive leadership to analyze feedback from staff, identify areas of improvement, establish org-wide priorities and programs, and coordinate to ensure the success of cross-functional initiatives

Successful Operations Lead candidates will have
  • A strong commitment to Swing Left's mission and values
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills; the demonstrated ability to provide outstanding customer service via written and verbal communication
  • Extensive knowledge on financial analysis, including demonstrated experience with managing an organizational budget, a strong understanding of accounting systems, and a command of Microsoft Excel/Google Sheets
  • Ability to diagnose problems quickly and foresee potential issues, and a strong solutions orientation
  • Experience and familiarity with the legal and compliance landscape of election-related activities and for 501(c)(4) organizations
  • Experience with people operations and general HR practices a must; additional experience with DEIB (diversity, equity, inclusion and belonging) work, talent recruitment and employee retention strongly preferred
  • Demonstrated success managing and leading staff and building an impact-driven, collaborative team culture
  • A keen interest in being an intentional organizational leader, trusted thought partner to executive leadership, and critical individual contributor 
  • A demonstrated commitment to equity and belonging across all identities including but not limited to race, gender, sexual orientation, age and ability. A specific track record of a commitment to BIPOC communities
  • Ability to work independently and collaborate effectively across teams in a remote environment
Working at Swing Left

The Operations Lead position is a full-time, exempt and remote position. The pay range for this position is $110,000 - $125,000 on an annualized basis. We provide cost of living compensation increases at the beginning of each year. 

In addition to health, dental, vision, and retirement benefits, Swing Left's benefits package includes a professional development fund, a remote work fund, and a technology stipend for all employees. We have an unlimited time-off policy, a flexible medical and parental leave policy, and our office is closed for approximately 25 business days each year. We are happy to answer any questions you have about our benefits and policies in interviews.

We are an equal opportunity employer and seek applications from all qualified candidates who are eligible to work in the United States. However, we are not able to sponsor visas at this time. 

We welcome all applicants regardless of age, citizenship, gender identity or expression, national origin, pregnancy status, race, religion, sexual orientation, veteran status, or any other differences.

Please note the best way to express interest in this position is to submit an application––this is the most effective way for our team to review and process applications fairly and efficiently.

results.title: Head of Development
results.description:
About Swing Left

Swing Left is a national grassroots organization working to elect Democrats up and down the ballot. We make it possible for anyone to make an impact on the elections that determine the balance of power in our country, by volunteering in and donating to key races. Since launching in 2017, Swing Left volunteers have raised $80 million for Democratic candidates, civic organizations, and voter mobilization efforts, and made more than 44 million combined phone calls, door knocks, and letters sent to voters via our affiliate Vote Forward and their partners.

About Vote Forward

Vote Forward is a 501(c)(4) nonprofit organization that builds tools to encourage Americans to vote. We work to increase the participation of traditionally underrepresented groups in the electorate, and to increase civic engagement among the public at large, by supporting the volunteers working to engage these voters. Since 2018, more than 250,000 grassroots volunteers have used the Vote Forward platform to send handwritten letters to more than 25 million prospective voters to encourage them to register to vote and turn out for elections. Vote Forward is closely affiliated with Swing Left, and Vote Forward staff work with Swing Left on many projects of mutual interest.

Overview

The primary responsibility of the Head of Development is to ensure Swing Left and Vote Forward have the financial resources necessary to execute their missions by leading the development and implementation of major donor and grassroots fundraising strategies in support of the organizations' annual operating budgets, as well as fundraising strategies for Swing Left target candidates and civic organizations. This role reports to the Managing Director and is an at-will position.

The Swing Left and Vote Forward team is fully remote, but there is an expectation for the Head of Development to attend in-person meetings and events in various locations around the country. Candidates should have the ability to travel regularly (approximately 5-8 days per month on average).

We aim to begin interviews for this position by early February. We expect to review the first batch of applications by January 20 and then will do a rolling review of applications until the position is filled and/or the application is closed. Please note that our office is closed between December 17 – January 2.

Responsibilities 

Lead the development, implementation, and execution of major donor and grassroots fundraising strategies for Swing Left and Vote Forward

  • Lead the development and implementation of cross-cutting fundraising strategies to drive goals––operational fundraising for Swing Left and Vote Forward, and fundraising for targeted candidates, campaigns and organizations, including via Blueprint
  • Directly manage the Development team, including consultants and full-time staff
  • Oversee the development and iterations of Blueprint, determine strategies for allocations, and work cross-functionally to maintain and grow its audience
  • Collaborate cross-functionally to develop and implement digital fundraising strategies with the Marketing team
  • Lead the assessment of the organization's existing strategies to identify priorities for program development and updates, and identify, develop, and implement new and improved strategies for fundraising 
  • Establish goals for fundraising, define systems and processes to measure success and track progress toward goals and work cross functionally to develop and implement strategies for meeting goals 

Oversee and lead the development, implementation, and execution of major donor strategy for Swing Left and Vote Forward and, in partnership with the Executive Director and rest of the development team, manage relationships with the organizations' major donors

  • Develop and implement fundraising strategies that will allow Swing Left and Vote Forward to accomplish their respective organizational goals
  • Oversee the research of potential major donors to gain insights into needs, beliefs, and donation habits to understand how to engage them in donating to Swing Left and Vote Forward
  • Identify, contact, and follow up with existing and prospective donors to provide information necessary for engagement
  • Develop programs that will engage and retain new and existing donors
  • Develop fundraising messages and collateral that are compelling to potential donors and consistent with the Swing Left and Vote Forward brands
  • Work with the Executive Director and development team to set fundraising goals and report on progress 
  • Work with the Executive Director and development team to build and strengthen relationships with donors and donor prospects
  • Organize campaigns and events that will lead to soliciting donors and/or in coordination with donors
  • Develop a process and structure for maintaining records of donor information and ensure accuracy of donor information
  • Develop and evaluate success of fundraising efforts and events and make adjustments to strategy as necessary
  • Develop donor and legal reporting documentation to ensure requirements are satisfied

Serve as a member of the organization's leadership team: collaborate with other leadership team members and executive leadership to analyze feedback from staff, identify areas of improvement, establish org-wide priorities and programs, and coordinate to ensure the success of cross-functional initiatives

Successful Head of Development candidates will have
  • A strong interest in Swing Left's mission and values
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills that demonstrate an ability to convey a compelling understanding of Swing Left and Vote Forward's mission and impact, and translate our data, research and analysis on strategy and electoral impact into persuasive narratives
  • At least 2 – 3 cycles (4 – 6 years) of increasing responsibility in a fundraising environment, with a proven track record of securing significant gifts from individuals, organizations, foundations, etc. 
  • Experience leading the creation and implementation of effective and successful donor cultivation and engagement programs
  • Experience with major donor fundraising in electoral, 501c(3), and 501c(4) contexts
  • Strongly prefer experience with digital fundraising in electoral, 501c(3), and 501c(4) contexts
  • Mastery of donor, principal, and key stakeholder relationship-building and management
  • Ability to work independently and collaborate effectively across teams in a remote environment
  • Ability to work under pressure and balance multiple priorities at once
  • Ability to diagnose problems quickly and foresee potential issues, and a strong solutions orientation
  • Demonstrated success managing and leading staff and building an impact-driven, collaborative team culture
  • A demonstrated commitment to equity and belonging across all identities including but not limited to race, gender, sexual orientation, age and ability. A specific track record of a commitment to BIPOC communities. 
  • A keen interest in being an intentional organizational leader, trusted thought partner to executive leadership, and critical individual contributor 
Working at Swing Left

The Development Lead position is a full-time, exempt and remote position. There is regular travel expected for this role (see more information in the Overview section of this posting). The pay range for this position is $148,565 – $165,073 on an annualized basis. We provide cost of living compensation increases at the beginning of each year. 

In addition to health, dental, vision, and retirement benefits, Swing Left's benefits package includes a professional development fund, a remote work fund, and a technology stipend for all employees. We have an unlimited time-off policy, a flexible medical and parental leave policy, and our office is closed for approximately 25 business days each year. We are happy to answer any questions you have about our benefits and policies in interviews.

We are an equal opportunity employer and seek applications from all qualified candidates who are eligible to work in the United States. However, we are not able to sponsor visas at this time. 

We welcome all applicants regardless of age, citizenship, gender identity or expression, national origin, pregnancy status, race, religion, sexual orientation, veteran status, or any other differences.

Please note the best way to express interest in this position is to submit an application––this is the most effective way for our team to review and process applications fairly and efficiently.

results.title: Senior Consultant
results.description:
Senior Consultant

Full-time, Part-time and Remote opportunities available

About Us

We're Nine Feet Tall … and growing!  We're a management consultancy that specialises in delivering complex change, combining the power of people and technology. Over the last sixteen years, we've delivered over £100m of value to our clients. We take the pain out of change and strive to help the transition to new ways of working.

Our Consultants come from all backgrounds but have one thing in common – we use our core values to guide our decision making - acting with integrity and doing the right thing, always striving for excellence and delivering with real passion.

If you're already in the world of consulting but it doesn't feel right, come and talk to us. Alternatively, if you're looking for more variety in your work and feel that consulting could be an option for you, we'd love to hear from you.

About You

Your career to date may have touched on all sorts of disciplines – Business Analysis, IT Project Management, PMO, Change Management - and you're looking for a role where you get the diversity of opportunity to continue with each element, or focus in on what you're really keen to specialise in.

You'll be ready to play a key role in the delivery of client engagements. You'll get to take the lead on specific deliverables and flex your project management know-how on critical workstreams.

But you'll also enjoy helping less experienced members of the team make the same journey you have.

The Role

The Senior Consultant role is one of the most diverse positions we have. You could be running workshops, delivering projects or helping to manage change - and you'll get experience of all kinds of different projects in a range of sectors. It's a role that can really fast-track your career.

We'll provide you with a focused learning and development programme to develop you into a successful consultant. It's not just about client delivery, it's about becoming a mentor to others and building the consultancy skill set to launch your career.

It's a position that will start to pull together all the key skills and attributes that you've gained so far, whilst also seeking out and developing the skills you probably haven't had the chance to fully engage with yet.

Why Apply?

We deliver all the capabilities of large consultancy with far less jargon and a lot more personality.

This is a great role to introduce yourself to Nine Feet Tall. How quickly you progress through our consultancy grades is up to you.

As an employer, we're proud to be truly flexible. We work hard to help our team find balance in their working and personal lives. That's why we're happy to consider applicants on either a full-time or flexible working (part-time 4 days per week or flexi-hours) basis. You'll be home-based in the first instance, with flexibility to come to our office in Bath 1 -2 times per month to training and for our regular Company Days that play a big role in our cohesive team culture.

We are growing our team across all roles so we'd love to hear from you and tell you more about what's on offer.

Remuneration

£35,000+ plus bonus and a competitive benefits package

Nine Feet Tall is an equal opportunities employer. We know that the principles of diversity, equality and inclusion are key to being a successful and dynamic business - with a team which is engaged and where everyone feels a sense of belonging and is happy to be themselves.

results.title: Implementation Consultant
results.description:
The Implementation Consultant will focus on onboarding new Fulfil customers on to our platform. You will work hand in hand with an Implementation team to craft an exceptional experience for merchants as they bring their entire merchant operations processes onto Fulfil. You will obsess over deadlines and work cross-functionally with multiple internal teams across product, engineering, sales, and account management to ensure timely delivery of each step of the onboarding process. This is a strategic customer success role that requires an air of confidence, and a prescriptive rather than a reactionary approach to ensure ease during this transition leading to a successful Launch and Go-Live.


What You’ll Do:

  • Work closely with the onboarding team to help new and existing merchants adopt Fulfil

  • Drive implementation planning, execution, and optimization support

  • Conduct business process mapping and requirements gathering sessions with new and existing customers to determine configuration requirements

  • Prepare business requirements and technical scoping documents derived from customer meetings towards a successful launch

  • Troubleshoot issues that arise during configuration sessions and dry runs

  • Provide on-going post implementation support to optimize user adoption onto Fulfil

  • Collaborate cross-functionally to ensure timeliness of each client deliverable

  • Project manage across all stakeholders (internally and externally) in order to ensure on-time delivery and exceed merchant expectations

  • Collaborate with other service and product areas to create a seamless experience for our merchants as they move from sales to data-migration, to set-up, delivery and go live.

  • Wear multiple hats and make the most of the opportunity to work at an amazing, innovative, and rapidly growing company; passionate about doing something incredible!




We’re Looking for Someone With:

  • 2+ years of experience managing multiple competing projects simultaneously from start to finish and have strong prioritization skills

  • Flexibility to work North American time zones - the successful candidate will overlap directly with the team in Toronto, Canada

  • Previous experience in a customer facing implementation, or project management role at a product company. SaaS experience preferred

  • Energy and a wicked work ethic - Customer Success is a 24/7 operation

  • A strong attention to detail with proficiency in MS Excel and spreadsheet automation

  • Previous experience in one or more of the following: Netsuite, SAP, JDA, MS Dynamics or other ERP/Supply Chain Management software;

  • Strong project management and cross-functional collaboration skills, you are a task-management expert!

  • A proactive mindset capable of creating a long-term vision, with a monthly/weekly plan and shipping velocity in days

  • The ability to diagnose and solve complex problems on the fly using critical thinking and persuasion

  • The ability to instill a deep sense of confidence in your clients to alleviate any worry they might develop when transitioning from an old, outdated (but familiar) system to a new service

  • An interest in e-commerce and the ability to quickly understand the Fulfil product suite

  • Superior oral and written communication skills

  • Genuine empathy for others and helping customers achieve their goals




Nice to Haves:

  • Prior experience at a growth stage Internet/Software company

  • Accounting degree, CPA designation or equivalent experience

  • Knowledge of support methodology and process, and experience using Zendesk

  • Experience with e-commerce technologies like Amazon or Shopify Plus

  • A sense of adventure and an entrepreneurial spirit

  • Coding ability or other technical experience e.g. SQL

  • Previous experience with one or more of the following: Netsuite, QuickBooksOnline, Xero, TaxJar, Avalara etc


About Us:


Fulfil.io helps high growth, high volume merchants simplify operations and scale for growth. With the rise in omnichannel commerce, Fulfil was founded with the simple idea that merchant operations need to be simplified in order to deliver amazing retail experiences. Fulfil enables businesses to turn their back-office operations into an accelerator for growth by integrating order management, inventory management, warehouse management, vendor/supplier management, wholesale, manufacturing, financials and customer service, into one seamless solution. We believe merchants should love their operations platform, and we work hard to make that happen every single day. Fulfil.io is a trusted solution for brands like DreamCloud, Mejuri, Lie-Nielsen Toolworks, and many more.

Fulfil.io is a technology company with offices in Toronto, Bangalore, and San Francisco. The team is made up of people who want to feel challenged at work, be the best at their craft and learn from one another. We come from different backgrounds and experiences, all passionate about the work we do, the team we do it with, and the customers we do it for. Join us in our journey to simplify operations and empower merchants around the world!

results.title: Operations / Chief of Staff
results.description:
CopilotIQ is perhaps the most exciting company at the intersection of technology and healthcare. A start-up that is transforming care for seniors with chronic conditions including diabetes and high blood pressure. The Copilot vision is to create a next gen telehealth platform with connected in-home devices, predictive artificial intelligence, and world-class care. Much like a pilot has a computer and person sitting next to them to ensure they stay safe, we believe every patient deserves to have someone watching over them and ensuring they are healthy.

Copilot is looking for an individual to play a critical role to help rapidly scale the business. It's a career-defining role for the right individual. You'll work directly with an experienced CEO.

Responsibilities and Duties:
  • You'll be doing hands-on execution in a very wide variety of areas including: insurance, HR, procurement, finance, product, etc.
  • You'll work directly with an experienced CEO of venture-funded companies

Qualifications:

  • Outstanding at figuring new things out and executing quickly
  • Must be very scrappy and very smart
  • Very organized and can keep a team on task with timelines
  • Great with looking at a problem and assessing how best to solve it and define lightweight processes
  • Strong attention to detail
  • Ideally 3+ years in an operations/chief of staff/project management role at a venture-backed startup
  • Advanced experience with Excel / Google Sheets & PowerPoint / Google Slides
  • Strong communicator who can build rapport and work with a wide variety of people

results.title: Business Operations Manager
results.description:
Company Description
Since 2004, Mandiant has been a trusted partner to security-conscious organizations. Effective security is based on the right combination of expertise, intelligence, and adaptive technology, and the Mandiant Advantage SaaS platform scales decades of frontline experience and industry-leading threat intelligence to deliver a range of dynamic cyber defense solutions. Mandiant’s approach helps organizations develop more effective and efficient cyber security programs and instills confidence in their readiness to defend against and respond to cyber threats.

Job Description

The Strategic Planning and Operations team serves as a trusted advisor to the business to help inform and guide decision making through business partner support and innovative & insightful analyses. We are looking for a bright, goal-oriented individual, who has a proven track record and can autonomously drive projects in a fast paced, collaborative environment and interface confidently with executive level management

What You Will Do:

  • Support strategy development and positioning of Mandiant services and solutions
  • Track and understand technological trends and shifts in the Security ecosystem that could provide new opportunities to Mandiant
  • Identify trends and develop strategic frameworks and competitive landscape maps for segments of interest to Mandiant
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop insight into root cause drivers of key operating metrics such as customer retention and behavior, product refresh cycles, individual product performance, etc
  • Prepare monthly and quarterly management reporting - analyze financial results, distill/synthesize key trends, and communicate key messages to senior management
  • Analyze financial and operational information to develop KPIs that help provide insights into operational effectiveness.
  • Assist Strategic Planning and Operations Leadership with analysis and presentation of key metrics and reporting
  • Leverage various Business Intelligence tools to provide reporting to the organization
  • Partner with cross-functional teams to provide analytical support of Operations


Qualifications
  • 5+ years experience the information technology field to include large-scale solution development and integration
  • 3+ years experience in technology consulting and cybersecurity discipline
  • In-depth knowledge with Software as a Subscription (SaaS) related terminology and metrics
  • Advanced Excel modeling skills (Marcos, Scenario Tools, Simulations) and PowerPoint deck story telling capability (with strong ability to incorporate key visualizations of data and concepts)
  • Strategic thinker with excellent business judgment who has a passion for tackling complex, financial/operational data and modeling
  • Excellent presentation/communication skills, with the ability to distill complex analyses into executive-level insights and recommendations
  • Must be self-motivated with an energetic, results-oriented and customer-focused style, coupled with strong planning and organizational skills
  • Ability to prioritize workload and the flexibility to manage changing priorities based on department and company needs with diplomacy


Additional Information
As a U.S. federal contractor, Mandiant has adopted a COVID-19 Vaccination Policy to comply with our obligations under applicable laws and requirements. This position may be covered under Mandiant’s COVID-19 Vaccination Policy, as required in order to support federal contracts, access company offices and/or attend in-person meetings and work events. If covered under this policy, proof of vaccination against COVID-19 may be required as a condition of hire. At Mandiant we are committed to our #OneTeam approach combining diversity, collaboration, and excellence. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, sex, color, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or on the basis of disability. Minimum Salary: 85,900.00. Final salary will be determined commensurately with cost of living, experience level, and/or any other legally permissible considerations. Incentive Compensation: Eligibility for annual bonus subject to individual and company performance; eligibility for award of Restricted Stock Units subject to eligibility requirements, approval from Mandiant’s Compensation Committee, and vesting terms. Benefits: Whether you are just starting your career, reaching a milestone, or gearing up for retirement, we offer plans and programs to keep you happy and healthy at any stage of life. We regularly evaluate our options to make sure they’ve got everything you need. Part of what makes Mandiant great is our diverse team, and we’ve made it our priority to provide benefits that support you on your individual journey at work and at home. Mandiant subsidized benefits include Medical, Dental, Vision, Life, and Disability Insurance. Subject to eligibility requirements, Mandiant also offers the ability to participate in 401(k), Flexible Spending Accounts, Health Savings Accounts, Dependent Care Spending Accounts, and Employee Stock Purchase Program. Mandiant also provides Paid Time Off, Flexible Paid Sick Time, and Paid Holidays.

results.title: Business Operations Manager
results.description:
Who we are

Path is a healthtech company dedicated to making mental health care work for everyone. Path takes a patient-first approach, where treatment is more accessible, personalized, and effective. With Path, it’s easy to find a high-quality therapist or psychiatrist who accepts insurance and is actively accepting new patients.

What we’re solving

Over 65 million Americans suffer from a treatable mental health issue — that’s 1 in 5 people. Today it’s difficult to find a provider, and for those with complicated conditions, it’s nearly impossible to find coordinated care. We’re here to fix this.

Our Mission

Path's mission is to make mental healthcare work for everyone.

About The Role 

Path is currently looking for a Business Operations Manager to be a member of our Provider/ Supply BizOps pod. You will partner closely with executives on strategic priorities, planning, coordination, and execution.

Path’s Business Operations team is a group of highly analytical generalists responsible for helping identify, diagnose and build solutions for the company’s highest-priority problems. We manage the strategic planning process, partner with executives to define and achieve our company OKRs, and ensure leaders constantly have a pulse on the health of the business. We use data to identify the areas we should be working on and lead cross-functional initiatives to solve them. 

You Will 

  • Be part of a “pod” (BizOps + Analytics) that is tied to a company Executive Sponsor and is aligned with one of Path’s strategic priorities
  • Help define the strategic plan and OKRs for your pod, including defining and leading Key Initiatives required to achieve your team’s OKRs
  • Get your hands dirty with data and modeling, including ad hoc SQL analyses, forecasting models (e.g., marketplace supply & demand balance), and simple Dashboards (e.g., week-over-week performance against plan)
  • Lead cross-functional projects end-to-end, including project scoping/definition, project management, and analyses (SQL, GSheets)

What We’re Looking For:

  • 3+ years of demonstrated high performance in Management or Strategy Consulting and/or Business Operations and Strategy roles at high-growth startups 
  • Highly strategic and able to structure ambiguous information, prioritize, and succinctly communicate a formed plan
  • Proficient in SQL (required), Google Sheets or Excel (required), and Looker (nice to have)
  • Able to draw business insights and operational takeaways from analyses and models
  • Strong communication skills
  • Strong problem-solving abilities
  • Proactive and can work autonomously
  • Able to learn, adapt and thrive quickly in a dynamic environment

#LI-RO1

Our Team

The people of Path are what truly define our mission and determine our impact on the world. We believe in building not only a team, but a diverse community that thrives by helping each other succeed and grow and inspiring each other by taking on big challenges.

For employees, Path is a 100% remote healthtech company and we’re HIRING! We're excited to bring people onto the team who are committed to raising the bar on mental health care.

results.title: Fulfillment Operations Manager, International
results.description:
Life360 is a Remote First company, which means a remote work environment will be the primary experience for all employees. All positions, unless otherwise specified, can be performed remotely and we are targeting candidates for this role who are located in the United Kingdom, Czech Republic, or the Netherlands.

About Life360

At Life360, we’re on a mission to simplify safety so families can live fully. Everyday more than 33 million members across 195 countries trust us to protect and connect their loved ones at home, on the road, and on the go.

From real-time location updates to keep everyone coordinated, to Crash Detection and 24/7 Roadside Assistance, Life360 is designed to free families from everyday worries. Our range of Driving Safety, Digital Safety, Location Safety, and Personal Safety features are there to keep our members safe every step of the way.

Life360 has more than 400 (and growing!) remote-first employees.

In 2021, Life360 acquired Tile, the pioneer in finding technology, and Jiobit, one of the top real-time location monitoring platforms for families. These expanded offerings mark an important step forward towards achieving our vision of being the world's leading platform for people, pets and things.

We value having a diverse and inclusive community from many backgrounds, so even if you don’t meet 100% of the below qualifications, you should still seriously consider applying!

About the Job

The Fulfillment Operations Manager is a key player at Life360. This person will manage all aspects of fulfillment and logistics for our customers in all channels. The Fulfillment Operations Manager will collaborate with cross-functional stakeholders in Sales, Finance, Marketing, Sales Operations and Customer Care in optimizing processes and problem solving. This person will be responsible for managing 3PL. They will be accountable for inbound & outbound shipments, KPI attainment, inventory management, performance to cost budget, and cost improvement initiatives.

What You’ll Do
  • Communicate with Sales, Sales Operations and Customer Care on fulfillment and logistics issues. 
  • Manage all 3PLs ensuring timely accurate delivery of all orders 
  • Lead weekly calls (daily during peak season) with 3PLs
  • Lead quarterly QBRs and assure achievement of all key metrics
  • Monitor day to day inbound & outbound freight from our 3PLs. Maintain customer delivery time SLAs (for B2C and B2B customers) 
  • Generate clear and concise reports on KPI data: order execution, returns and backlog status. 
  • Investigate and resolve all fulfillment operations issues, including  inventory discrepancies, unfulfilled shipments, and processing errors 
  • Monitor EDI and ASNs transmissions
  • Manage all inventory, minimizing exposure to lost inventory by managing and auditing 3PL cycle count programs, performing monthly inventory reconciliations, and coordinating all inventory adjustments with Finance
  • Manage RMA process for retailers to assure timely credits to Retailers and Distributors as well as managing B-stock to minimize scrap inventory and maximize yield on returns.
  • Manage process improvement initiatives for responsible regions 
  • Support any new regional expansion requirements including input on site location and vendor selection
  • Collaborate with Sales and  Sales Operations to ensure accurate forecasts are delivered in regular cadence to our 3PL partners to ensure KPI attainment and minimize cost
  • Manage all packaging, dunnage and shipping decisions to reduce cost and minimize damages
  • Participate in annual budgeting process
  • Manage all special projects as needed 
What We’re Looking For
  • 7+ years experience in global retail and direct to consumer operations; preferably in CE industry 
  • Deep understanding of Sales Operations cycles, inventory management, forecasting, and 3PL order management 
  • Proficiency in Excel required, incl. proficiency in use of pivot tables, V-lookups, sumifs, etc.
  • Experience with ERP systems, preferably NetSuite and EDI (incl. EDI setups and troubleshooting of EDI failures)
  • Experience with managing deliveries to Amazon
  • Effective communication skills (written and verbal)
  • Flexible; the role interfaces with international teams (APAC, NA)
  • Willingness to learn and wear multiple hats  
  • Self starter; excellent multi-tasker; able to work independently
  • Comfortable working in a high paced environment with frequent interruptions 
  • Good Judgment. Can gather information, weigh relevant factors and make quick, high-quality decisions based on data, trends, and past experience with little guidance. 
  • Quality in Performance. Demonstrates accuracy and thoroughness; looks for ways to improve and promote quality of operations, processes, and performance in self and others; applies feedback to improve performance
  • Efficient & Motivated. Performs at a high level of efficiency; completes work in a timely manner; self-motivated and strives to increase productivity
  • Dependable. Follows instructions, responds to management direction; assumes responsibility for own actions
  • Strong Problem Solver. Demonstrates creativity and innovation in designing plans and generating solutions to meet logistics related and/or staff challenges
  • Experience negotiating contracts
  • Big-Picture Thinker with an eye for the details  
  • Effective communication skills (written and verbal)
  • Able to travel 10-20% including international travel as needed 
Life360 Values

Our company’s mission driven culture is guided by our shared values to create a trusted work environment where you can bring your authentic self to work and make a positive difference 

  • Be a Good Person - We have a team of high integrity people you can trust. 
  • Be Direct With Respect - We communicate directly, even when it’s hard.
  • Members Over Metrics - We focus on building an exceptional experience for families. 
  • High Intensity High Impact - We do whatever it takes to get the job done. 
Our Commitment to Diversity

We believe that different ideas, perspectives and backgrounds create a stronger and more creative work environment that delivers better results. Together, we continue to build an inclusive culture that encourages, supports, and celebrates the diverse voices of our employees. It fuels our innovation and connects us closer to our customers and the communities we serve. We strive to create a workplace that reflects the communities we serve and where everyone feels empowered to bring their authentic best selves to work.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at Life360. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status or any legally protected status.  

We encourage people of all backgrounds to apply. We believe that a diversity of perspectives and experiences create a foundation for the best ideas. Come join us in building something meaningful.

#LI-Remote

____________________________________________________________________________

Since the majority of our staff is located on the US West Coast, our primary working hours will be 9-4pm PST

results.title: Infrastructure and Operations Manager
results.description:
At Gozio, we're redefining the meaning of patient experience in health systems across the U.S. Our mobile platform offers a single point of access for everything a patient or visitor needs, including telehealth, medical records, physician appointments and reminders, and indoor navigation and wayfinding. We help take the stress out of visits to the hospital.

As a manager of the infrastructure team, you will manage a growing team of cloud and devops engineers as you build our cloud based platform. You will play a key role in directing team growth, organizational management, and coordination with internal groups. 

Your Responsibilities:

  • Manage the infrastructure and operations team consisting of cloud and devops engineers who work primarily in AWS
  • Architect infrastructure for high availability and resiliency; enable disaster recovery and Gozio's maturing SLA obligations
  • Develop methodologies to automate cloud architecture and solution deployments in a secure and reliable way
  • Create and maintain documentation to support deployment, maintenance, and monitoring of the cloud architecture and solutions
  • Assist in contract negotiations for cloud infrastructure technologies and services
  • Own administration and user provisioning of key SaaS services
  • Coordinate infrastructure team's role in product releases; manage infrastructure backlog accordingly

results.title: Business Analyst
results.description:

results.title: Personal Assistant
results.description:
Strafe Creative is seeking a hands-on, experienced PA to support the Managing Director in ongoing business growth. We’ve been growing steadily over the last few years, working on bigger projects, with more clients and regularly hiring new members of staff. Overseeing the business growth is the Managing Director, who, after 12 years in the role is keen to work with a dedicated Personal Assistant to keep them organised and focused on the ongoing growth of the business.

The Role

Who are we?
Strafe Creative is an independent, award-winning digital design agency, proud to be working on a range of projects, from websites and mobile gaming to SaaS apps and more.

We’re based in Nottingham, however remote working is the new office life these days so this role can be based anywhere, although we’d love to see you in the office once a month or so. We’re a fun, passionate bunch of people to work with and we’d love someone like-minded to join us!

Learn a bit more about Strafe:

  • Who we are and what we do
  • What it’s really like to work at Strafe by the people who work there
  • The Strafe Creative Family Policy, because work isn’t your whole life
  • A sneak peak into how we are always learning and growing


What’s the job then?
As the first PA within the business, you’ll have the opportunity to grow and shape the role as you see fit. Typical tasks will include:


  • Inbox Management & Calendar Appointments on behalf of the MD; filing, prioritising and responding where appropriate
  • Taking meeting notes - to help keep everyone in the loop on sales or client meetings
  • Managing ad-hoc travel arrangements, including flights, accommodation and itineraries
  • Supporting the delivery of ad hoc research and projects in partnership with the Managing Director
  • Updating and creating presentations - so that the MD can focus on looking after the client experience
  • Keeping the Director on track - making sure they attend priority meetings and stick to the business goals and actions
  • Updating the CRM System (Hubspot) to ensure the quality of lead and client data is of a very high standard
  • Updating and managing key sales documents via the Google suite


Sound up your street? Here’s how to apply
Send us a CV, cover letter and a short video no more than 2 minutes long. We're keen to hire a new team member that fits in with us - someone who is a real people person and enjoys working closely with the team.

In the video, please talk about one of the following topics and show us how you communicate:


  • The thing you're most proud of and why
  • Your favourite hobby and why you love it
  • Your best holiday and why


(Hint, we want to see you talking about something you love and how you handle the direction we've provided).

Cover letter-wise, focus on what you would bring to the role and how you would go about managing our busy MD.

Please send all three items to careers@strafecreative.co.uk or use the form at the bottom of this page to submit.

Salary

£24-£28k (Based on experience)

results.title: SAP Business One Consultant
results.description:
About Sapphire Systems:

Sapphire is the largest digital operating transformation provider to the mid-market and mid-enterprise clients. Our mission is to turn operating friction into digital business momentum. Through the passion and expertise of our people, we unlock the cloud-delivered operating platforms, digital user experiences, data analytics, and intelligent automation that transforms our client’s operational performance. We are globally significant partners for SAP, ServiceNow, Automation Anywhere, Infor, Hexagon and AWS, and we have transformed the digital operating capacity, capability, intelligence and resilience of over 1,250 clients in the UK and US through our portfolio of consulting, design, delivery, lifecycle service, and cloud services.


Job Summary:

This key client facing role requires the combination of

  • demonstrable SAP Business One configuration ability and knowledge (version 9.3+).
  • a client-engagement skill set that is both flexible and inspires confidence.

The role operates within the SAP B1 practice and across the many different industries in which Sapphire provides its services. From project mobilisation to go-live, this delivery role is at the forefront of Sapphire work to enhance and transform its client’s operations.

This is a consulting role and as such, whilst the hours resolve around a standard working day for the region, there are times when the job holder will need to work outside these times to assure the project’s progress and success.

Duties/Responsibilities: 

  • Provide guidance with process design.
  • Design, develop, and test automation workflows.
  • Providing implementation consultation and support services during the different phases of SAP Business One implementations, upgrades and other ad-hoc projects.
  • Proficiency with the US and UK SAP localisations; other localisations are an advantage.
  • Proficiency in using SQL-query, views and stored procedures. Proficiency in HANA syntaxis and reporting.
  • Proficiency in the data structures of SAP B1 and any add-ons
  • Customising forms and developing reports using Crystal Reports
  • Perform customizations via Transaction Notification; able to create formatted searches; and other complex system modifications via the Boyum B1 Usability Package; recognising and addressing gaps between SAP Business One solutions / add-ons and the business practices of the client.
  • Able to encourage the best practice for the client, even if this means the client changing their practices or processes.
  • Designing and conducting master data migration guidance or assistance from legacy systems into SAP Business One.
  • Helping to maintain or update Sapphire’s deployment methodology and share expertise with peers.
  • Prepare well-structured presentations, facilitate design, client training and client workshops or presentations, whether virtual or face to face.
  • Configure and optimise SAP Business One applications and solutions per the design documentation.
  • Able to follow and configure SAP B1 or add-on components from a system design document created by other peers or from a joint design.
  • Undertake unit testing and support User Acceptance Testing (UAT) paying attention to versioning and transition from development and test to production phases.
  • Maintain a project within the agreed scope and assist the project manager in identifying and quantifying change requests
  • Able to demonstrate a basic level of IT infrastructure awareness
  • Confident in presenting and explaining complex ERP or data concepts to the client
  • Demonstrate experience of working in a consulting capacity with clients, including management of time, quality and cost
  • Able to troubleshoot implementation issues and identify the root cause
  • Writing coherent, comprehensive and concise customer implementation and design documentation
  • Demonstrable client engagement expertise and confidence that results in the client asking for the individual by name for further work
  • Adds ideas, improvement and content to Sapphire’s SAP B1 deployment playbook.
  • Demonstrates a flexible work ethic and comfortable working remotely or on-site.
  • Teamwork skills


The ideal candidate will be:

  • Recent SAP Business One Accreditation (9.3 or higher) is highly desirable
  • Boyum B1 Usability package certification is desirable
  • Any other add-on product accreditations are desirable
  • 5 or more years of relevant application consultancy in SAP B1
  • Evidence of working in a consultative capacity with concurrent multiple clients

results.title: Business Operations Manager
results.description:
About Apollo

Founded in 2015, Apollo is a leading sales intelligence and engagement platform trusted by over 20,000 paying customers, from rapidly growing startups to the largest global enterprises. Our platform unifies a database of 250m contacts and 60 million business accounts with advanced intelligence and engagement tools, to help over 500,000 sales, marketing, and recruiting professionals to connect with the right person at the right time with the right message, at speed and scale. We're also ranked #1 in Satisfaction on G2 Crowd for Sales Intelligence & Sales Engagement and are used by 1M professionals worldwide.

In the last year, we’ve grown ARR 3x, quadrupled our active users, maintained profitability, and closed a $110M Series C led by Sequoia Capital in March of 2022 to fuel the next phase of our growth. 

Working at Apollo

We are a remote-first inclusive organization focused on operational excellence.  Our way of working ensures clear expectations and an environment to do your best work with ample reward.

Role & Team:

The mission of Apollo’s Business Operations team is to bring data insight, operational capability and strategic vision to drive growth and product strategy at Apollo. We partner with the executive team to define Apollo's business strategy, drive cross-functional projects and unlock new growth opportunities. Our team provides strategic perspectives and analytical horsepower to solve critical business strategy, optimization, and operations problems across the organization. 

We are a team of individuals with complementary skill sets. You will work collaboratively across Go-To-Market, Product, Finance and Marketing teams on a variety of strategic initiatives with a direct and quantifiable impact to our P&L. You will identify actionable insights, assess their impact, and lead execution & implementation. As one of the first members of the Business Operations team, you will be instrumental in shaping the future of the function and the overall business.

Responsibilities:

  • Partner with key stakeholders across product, marketing, sales, and customer experience to drive product and business strategy by synthesizing insights and setting actionable plans.
  • Drive high-impact cross-functional initiatives such as pricing strategy, strategic investments and geographic expansion.
  • Leverage your business background to design and implement strong systems, processes and company rituals that will drive performance and collaboration throughout the organization.
  • Drive annual and quarterly business and OKR planning cycles with the leadership team to ensure Apollo is focusing and actioning on the most important near-term and long-term priorities.
  • Partner with the leadership team to define and iterate upon Apollo’s vision, mission and product strategy and conduct the requisite market, product and competitive analysis for these critical initiatives. 

Qualifications:

  • 4+ years of experience in highly strategic, operational, and analytical environments e.g. business operations, product management, investment banking, strategy consulting, private equity or venture capital.
  • Ability to solve complex business problems, think from first principles, and build scalable processes.
  • Strong analytical skills, including fluency with Microsoft Excel and BI tools like Looker, Tableau, and/or Amplitude. Knowledge of SQL is strongly preferred but not required. 
  • Experience in efficient and rigorous analysis, research and insight generation, and building hypotheses and an action plan. 
  • Proven track record of building strong collaborative relationships with teammates from a variety of backgrounds, geographies and disciplines.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

What You’ll Love About Apollo

Besides the great compensation package and culture that thrives in openness and excellence, we invest tremendous effort into developing our remote employees’ careers. The team embraces that we have a sole purpose: to help customers maximize their full revenue potential on the Apollo platform. This mindset opens us up to a lot of creative approaches to making customers successful at scale. You’ll be a significant part of a lean, remote team, empowered to really own your role as a proactive educator. We’re very collaborative at Apollo, so you’ll be able to lean on your teammates, even in adjacent departments, to help you achieve lofty goals. You’ll be supported and encouraged to experiment and take educated risks that lead to big wins. And, you’ll have a whole team remotely by your side to help you do it!

results.title: Chief of Staff
results.description:
Our Mission

We uplift people and economies around the world through entrepreneurship.

To know more about 500 Latin America, click here.

Who We Are

500 Global is a venture capital firm with $2.7B in assets under management that invests in founders building fast-growing technology companies. We focus on markets where technology, innovation, and capital can unlock long-term value and drive economic growth. We work closely with key stakeholders and advise governments and corporations on how best to support entrepreneurial ecosystems so startups can thrive.

500 Global has backed over 5,000 founders representing more than 2,600 companies operating in 81 countries. We have invested in 51 companies valued at over $1 billion and 140+ companies valued at over $100 million (including private, public, and exited companies). Our 140+ plus team members are located in more than 20 countries and bring experience as entrepreneurs, investors, and operators from some of the world’s leading technology companies.

What We Need

The Chief of Staff for 500 Latin America (“CoS”) will be working with the Firm’s Managing Partner based in Latin America to facilitate the execution of strategic priorities, through relationship building, communications, project management, and problem-solving,

This person will serve as the right hand to the Managing Partner for their most important priorities, including the day-to-day operations of various regions, business units, and special projects, working closely with the Product and Portfolio Value teams to help them lead cross-functional projects.

The CoS will act as a strategist, consultant, and implementer, to ensure streamlined activities across Latin America and globally. They will contribute to the long-term success of the Firm by focusing on scaling operational infrastructure, as well as our expansion into new markets and products by seamlessly moving between strategic and tactical roadmaps.

We work at an incredible pace, so this person will need to be a self-starter with excellent EQ, written, verbal, and visual communication skills, strong time management skills, uncanny attention to detail, the ability to work under pressure in a fast-paced environment, and above all, flexibility and discretion. This role may require non-standard working hours across multiple time zones and significant travel.

This position will be remote, although candidates already based in Mexico would be preferred for time zone coverage.

Who You Are

You share our passion for uplifting people and economies around the world through entrepreneurship. You thrive in entrepreneurial, creative, fast-paced environments managing multiple time zones and working with people around the world from different backgrounds and cultures. You have exceptional communication skills, organizational skills, keen attention to detail and a strong ability to manage relationships and projects, start-to-end. You gain energy from managing a wide variety of tasks and can change focus quickly as our industry and business needs change. You bring boundless positivity and energy to any workplace you work in.

What You Will Be Doing

Overall, the role is expected to be fluid and the candidate needs to be flexible, working alongside the shifting needs of the Firm. However, expected duties and responsibilities will include the following:

  • Act as an advisor to the Managing Partner assisting in facilitating effective decision-making and implementation, and working on projects and strategies.
  • Develop, manage and implement successful and consistent operational processes, systems, tools, playbooks, solutions and programs to make functions and projects more effective.
  • Coordinate and project manage the execution of assigned strategic initiatives, with specific responsibility for cross-functional delivery of key projects, ensuring smooth collaboration across multiple geographies and teams, tracking performance and successful completion of short and long-term goals reporting back to the Managing Partner on progress, blockers and risks.
  • Act as the communication arm for the Managing Partner with team members, clients, investors, community members and other stakeholders.
  • Organize and gather information from various departments and meetings on assigned strategic priorities and report that information, along with recommendations, to the Managing Partner.
  • Oversee the research and preparation of decks and briefing materials on strategic priorities or investor relations matters for upcoming meetings and events, draft event briefings and talking points, and support preparation for internal and external events on behalf of the Managing Partner.
  • Handling inquiries and routine or complex responsibilities as delegated.

Requirements

  • Experience in creative problem-solving and eliminating barriers at any organizational level.
  • Superior analytical and project management capabilities. Proven ability in prioritizing workflows, working independently within tight deadlines, and collaborating across teams with limited supervision.
  • Comfortable managing multiple projects across a wide variety of functional business problems.
  • Clear, effective communicator across written and verbal communication; able to influence and collaborate with stakeholders across functions at all levels of experience.
  • Creativity and comfortable with ‘blank sheet of paper’ assignments. Comfortable with ambiguity and identifying what may be needed to define clarity.
  • Discreet and trustworthy in handling sensitive commercial information and conducting discussions accordingly.

Technical Requirements

  • Strongly proficient in Excel / Sheets and Powerpoint / Slides.
  • Familiarity with CRM and database software.

Education & Experience

  • Strong academic track record, with a degree in Law, Business, Economics or Management.
  • 4-6 years of work experience as a Chief of Staff in an international organization, or work experience in either a top-tier strategy consulting firm or in-house strategy team, a high growth technology startup or venture capital firm, or a top-tier legal firm.

This role is accepting candidates based in Mexico. You must have the right to live and work in the country where you are located.
